sources.title: "What the Daisy Said" (1910) director D. W. Griffith with Mary Pickford
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "What the Daisy Said" is a short drama. The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. Mary Pickford ignores what the daisy said and has her fortune told by a gypsy woman. This leads to enormous complications.   Directed by               D. W. Griffith Produced by             Biograph Company Scenario by                Stanner E.V. Taylor       Starring                     Mary Pickford, Gertrude Robinson, Joe Graybill, Clara Bracy, Verner Clarges, Charles West Cinematography        Billy Bitzer Distributed by           Biograph Company Release date               July 11, 1910 Running time             12 min. metadata.Plot: Two sisters want to know whether there is romance in their future. One sister pulls the petals off of a flower, while the other has her fortune told by a gypsy. When the gypsy tells the fortune so as to serve his own purposes, complications soon develop.
metadata.Actors: Mary Pickford, Gertrude Robinson, Joseph Graybill
